org.gridgain.grid
Interface GridCloud

All Known Subinterfaces:
GridRichCloud
public interface GridCloud

This interface defines cloud descriptor.

Cloud logically defines collection of cloud resources. Cloud resources form one or more undirected graphs where each resource in the graph can link to zero or more other resources in the same graph. Note that resource graphs cannot have loops.

This interface provide a system view on the cloud. All user-level APIs work with GridRichCloud interface that provides much more functionality and extends this interface. Consult GridRichCloud for more information.

Wiki & Forum:

Method Summary
 String id()
          Gets unique ID of this cloud.

Method Detail

id

String id()
Gets unique ID of this cloud.

Returns:
Unique ID of this cloud.

parameters

Map<String,String> parameters()
Gets optional vendor's parameters associated with this cloud. In general, it is up to the cloud SPI implementation to decide what, if any, metadata will be provided. Also, there is no specific requirement fot this metadata to be constant from call to call and SPI implementation can decide to make the metadata dynamically changing. Please consult cloud SPI implementation for further details.

Returns:
Vendor's parameters associated with this cloud.

resources

Collection<GridCloudResource> resources(@Nullable
                                        GridPredicate<? super GridCloudResource>... p)
Gets collection of resources that define this cloud current state. Note that this method effectively returns a current snapshot of the cloud and can be changing from call to call. All resources in this cloud can be logically viewed as a collection of disjoint graphs. Note that resource graphs cannot have loops.

Note that you can subscribe for cloud events and detect when cloud resources are changing if more deterministic behavior is required.

Parameters:
p - Optional filter for the resources. If none provided - all cloud resources from the current snapshot will be returned.
Returns:
Collection of cloud resources that define this cloud current state.
